Here’s a quick step by step guide on progressing the PlankSet a range similar to a rep range. For example, 45 to 60 seconds. Let’s say in the beginning you are only able to do 45 seconds. Each week, try to add a bit more time (25 secs). Once you are able to complete 60 seconds with good form time to further progress.Switch to a more difficult variation. The natural next step is switching to the Hand Plank. Keep your same time range of 4560 seconds. Since this is a more difficult variation you will likely fatigue before 60 seconds. Build your way back to 60 seconds like you did with the Forearm Plank. Add weight. At this point, it’s time to try adding some resistance to the Plank. Start light! You can either ask a gym buddy or place the weight on your back yourself. Either way, make sure the plate is in the middle of your upper back and not your lumbar spine. Then you can progress the plank similarly to any other exercise. By adding weight bit by bit overtime.You can continue to progress by going to a more difficult hold (Long Lever Plank, Hollow Hold) and then adding weight to those over time.
steps: Start in a kneeling position with your hands planted on the ground., Pick your knees up off the ground. Hold in this position with a flat back.

name: Hollow Hold
description: Lay flat on the ground with your arms extended over head., Pick your upper back and your legs off the ground. Your body should be in a banana shape., Hold in this position.
steps: Lay flat on the ground with your arms extended over head., Pick your upper back and your legs off the ground. Your body should be in a banana shape., Hold in this position.

name: Dumbbell Hollow Hold
description: Lay flat on the ground with a dumbbell overhead., Pull your upper back and legs off the ground. Make a banana shape with your body., The dumbbell should be held in your hands and your ears should be between your biceps.
steps: Lay flat on the ground with a dumbbell overhead., Pull your upper back and legs off the ground. Make a banana shape with your body., The dumbbell should be held in your hands and your ears should be between your biceps.

name: Mountain Climber
description: To perform a bodyweight mountain climber, start in a plank position with your hands placed directly under your shoulders., Bring your right knee towards your chest, keeping your foot close to your hand. Quickly switch legs, bringing your left knee towards your chest., Continue this movement, alternating legs, at a quick pace for a set amount of time or repetitions.
steps: To perform a bodyweight mountain climber, start in a plank position with your hands placed directly under your shoulders., Bring your right knee towards your chest, keeping your foot close to your hand. Quickly switch legs, bringing your left knee towards your chest., Continue this movement, alternating legs, at a quick pace for a set amount of time or repetitions.

name: Plate Situp
description: Start by lying on your back on a mat with your legs bent and feet flat on the ground., Hold a weight plate over your head with both hands, making sure to keep your arms straight., Engage your core and use your abdominal muscles to sit up, keeping the weight plate towards the ceiling.
steps: Start by lying on your back on a mat with your legs bent and feet flat on the ground., Hold a weight plate over your head with both hands, making sure to keep your arms straight., Engage your core and use your abdominal muscles to sit up, keeping the weight plate towards the ceiling.

name: Weighted Forearm Plank
description: Get into a kneeling position with both forearms pressed into the ground., Place a weight plate on your back (or have a partner do it for you)., Hold the plank for the allotted amount of time.
steps: Get into a kneeling position with both forearms pressed into the ground., Place a weight plate on your back (or have a partner do it for you)., Hold the plank for the allotted amount of time.

name: Weighted Hand Plank
description: Start in a kneeling position with your hands planted on the ground., Place a weight plate on your back or have a friend do it for you., Pick your knees up off the ground. Hold in this position with a flat back.
steps: Start in a kneeling position with your hands planted on the ground., Place a weight plate on your back or have a friend do it for you., Pick your knees up off the ground. Hold in this position with a flat back.

name: Plate Hollow Hold
description: Lay flat on the ground with your arms extended over head holding a weight plate., Pick your upper back and your legs off the ground. Your body should be in a banana shape.
steps: Lay flat on the ground with your arms extended over head holding a weight plate., Pick your upper back and your legs off the ground. Your body should be in a banana shape.

name: Dumbbell Crunch
description: Start by lying flat on your back with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent., Hold a dumbbell over your clavicle., Engage your core muscles and lift your torso off the floor until your shoulders are a few inches off the ground., Lower yourself back down to the starting position, but avoid resting completely on the floor between reps.
steps: Start by lying flat on your back with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent., Hold a dumbbell over your clavicle., Engage your core muscles and lift your torso off the floor until your shoulders are a few inches off the ground., Lower yourself back down to the starting position, but avoid resting completely on the floor between reps.

name: Dumbbell Suitcase Crunch
description: Lay flat on the ground with a dumbbell. Point the soles of your shoes at the ceiling as well as the dumbbell., Reach for your feet with the dumbbell before bringing your spine back to the floor.
steps: Lay flat on the ground with a dumbbell. Point the soles of your shoes at the ceiling as well as the dumbbell., Reach for your feet with the dumbbell before bringing your spine back to the floor.

name: TRX Forearm Plank
description: Lie face down on the ground and place your forearms on the ground directly under your shoulders., With your feet in the stirrups, kick both feet into the TRX straps and hold the handles above your head., Tighten your abs, glutes, and legs to form a straight line from your head to your feet.
steps: Lie face down on the ground and place your forearms on the ground directly under your shoulders., With your feet in the stirrups, kick both feet into the TRX straps and hold the handles above your head., Tighten your abs, glutes, and legs to form a straight line from your head to your feet.

name: TRX Hand Plank
description: Start by facing away from the TRX straps and placing your feet in the TRX handles with your palms on the ground., Lift your knees off the ground to begin the set., Engage your core and maintain this position for the desired amount of time, holding a steady plank.
steps: Start by facing away from the TRX straps and placing your feet in the TRX handles with your palms on the ground., Lift your knees off the ground to begin the set., Engage your core and maintain this position for the desired amount of time, holding a steady plank.

name: TRX Knee Tuck
description: Place your feet in the TRX stirrups and get in to a hand plank position., Pull your knees to your chest and flex your abs.
steps: Place your feet in the TRX stirrups and get in to a hand plank position., Pull your knees to your chest and flex your abs.

name: TRX Mountain Climber
description: Start in a plank position with the TRX straps adjusted to mid-calf length. Place your feet in the TRX stirrups., Keep your abs engaged, and bring one knee towards your chest while keeping the other leg extended behind you., Switch legs, bringing the opposite knee towards your chest while keeping your abs engaged and your back straight.
steps: Start in a plank position with the TRX straps adjusted to mid-calf length. Place your feet in the TRX stirrups., Keep your abs engaged, and bring one knee towards your chest while keeping the other leg extended behind you., Switch legs, bringing the opposite knee towards your chest while keeping your abs engaged and your back straight.

name: TRX Pike
description: Place your feet in the stirrups and get in to a plank position., Pull your hips straight up toward the ceiling., Lower your hips until youre back in a plank position.
steps: Place your feet in the stirrups and get in to a plank position., Pull your hips straight up toward the ceiling., Lower your hips until youre back in a plank position.

name: Kettlebell Russian Twist
description: Sit on the floor with your legs bent, knees together and feet raised slightly off the floor., Starting on one side and sitting up straight with your core muscles engaged, lift the kettlebell off the floor with both hands and bring it across your body to the other side, rotating your chest towards the floor as you do so., Tap the kettlebell lightly on the floor and bring the kettlebell back across your body to the starting position, rotating your chest towards the floor., Repeat, keeping the legs bent and feet raised throughout the exercise.
steps: Sit on the floor with your legs bent, knees together and feet raised slightly off the floor., Starting on one side and sitting up straight with your core muscles engaged, lift the kettlebell off the floor with both hands and bring it across your body to the other side, rotating your chest towards the floor as you do so., Tap the kettlebell lightly on the floor and bring the kettlebell back across your body to the starting position, rotating your chest towards the floor., Repeat, keeping the legs bent and feet raised throughout the exercise.

name: Kettlebell Windmill
description: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart. Hold the kettlebell in one hand and extend your arm above your head., Keeping your legs straight and the kettlebell above your head, lower the relaxed arm towards the ground, twisting your body towards the side of the raised arm., Return to the starting potion, tilt your pelvis forward and repeat.
steps: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart. Hold the kettlebell in one hand and extend your arm above your head., Keeping your legs straight and the kettlebell above your head, lower the relaxed arm towards the ground, twisting your body towards the side of the raised arm., Return to the starting potion, tilt your pelvis forward and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Russian Twist
description: Sit on the floor and flex your knees and hips to a 90 degree angle., Your feet should be hovering off the ground. (If thats too hard start with heels on the floor), Rotate your upper spine to engage your obliques.
steps: Sit on the floor and flex your knees and hips to a 90 degree angle., Your feet should be hovering off the ground. (If thats too hard start with heels on the floor), Rotate your upper spine to engage your obliques.

name: Bodyweight Russian Twist
description: Hover your heels just off the ground., Stick your chest out and maintain a flat back. Make all the movement happen at your mid and upper spine., Point your chest to the left, then rotate at the spine until your chest is pointed right.
steps: Hover your heels just off the ground., Stick your chest out and maintain a flat back. Make all the movement happen at your mid and upper spine., Point your chest to the left, then rotate at the spine until your chest is pointed right.

name: Dumbbell Half Kneeling Wood Chopper
description: Take a half kneeling position. Start with the dumbbell by your knee on the side of the kneeling leg., Rotate at the upper spine, holding the dumbbell away from your body with nearly extended elbows.
steps: Take a half kneeling position. Start with the dumbbell by your knee on the side of the kneeling leg., Rotate at the upper spine, holding the dumbbell away from your body with nearly extended elbows.

name: Plate Russian Twist
description: Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button toward your spine., Slowly twist your upper body to the right, keeping your feet flat on the ground and your back straight., Hold for a second and then twist to the left, holding for another second.
steps: Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button toward your spine., Slowly twist your upper body to the right, keeping your feet flat on the ground and your back straight., Hold for a second and then twist to the left, holding for another second.

name: Cobra Pose
description: Lie on your stomach with your legs extended behind you, feet hip-width apart., Place your palms on the ground next to your shoulders, with your elbows close to your sides., Inhale and press down through your palms, lifting your chest and shoulders off the ground while keeping your elbows close to your sides., Hold the pose for a few breaths, then release and repeat as desired.
steps: Lie on your stomach with your legs extended behind you, feet hip-width apart., Place your palms on the ground next to your shoulders, with your elbows close to your sides., Inhale and press down through your palms, lifting your chest and shoulders off the ground while keeping your elbows close to your sides., Hold the pose for a few breaths, then release and repeat as desired.

name: Urdhva Dhanurasana Wheel Pose
description: Lie down on your back with your feet hip-distance apart and your knees bent., Place your hands on the floor beside your head, fingertips pointing towards your shoulders., Push your feet and hands into the floor, lift your hips up and straighten your arms., Lift your chest towards the ceiling and hold the pose for a few breaths before lowering back down.
steps: Lie down on your back with your feet hip-distance apart and your knees bent., Place your hands on the floor beside your head, fingertips pointing towards your shoulders., Push your feet and hands into the floor, lift your hips up and straighten your arms., Lift your chest towards the ceiling and hold the pose for a few breaths before lowering back down.

name: Machine 45 Degree Back Extension
description: Position your thighs on the padding and hook your feet on the platform supports., Keeping your back straight, slowly bend at your waist until your legs and back are at a 45° angle., Slowly raise your body to the starting position.
steps: Position your thighs on the padding and hook your feet on the platform supports., Keeping your back straight, slowly bend at your waist until your legs and back are at a 45° angle., Slowly raise your body to the starting position.

name: Lower back Stretch Variation Four
description: Lay flat against the ground with your knees at an angle and your feet flat against the floor., Grab your legs just below the knees, and pull your legs towards your chest., Pause at the apex of the stretch, then return to the starting position.
steps: Lay flat against the ground with your knees at an angle and your feet flat against the floor., Grab your legs just below the knees, and pull your legs towards your chest., Pause at the apex of the stretch, then return to the starting position.

name: Lower back Stretch Variation Three
description: Lay on your back with your arms at either side., Raise your knees so that they are pointing straight towards the ceiling. Keeping your legs pressed together, rotate your hips to either side., Repeat this motion as necessary.
steps: Lay on your back with your arms at either side., Raise your knees so that they are pointing straight towards the ceiling. Keeping your legs pressed together, rotate your hips to either side., Repeat this motion as necessary.

name: Lower back Stretch Variation Two
description: Lay flat on the floor with your arms at either side., With one leg, hook one foot under the joint of your other leg., Rotate your hips so that your knees are pointing sideways, keeping your hooked leg flat against the floor., Pause at the apex of the stretch and repeat with your other leg.
steps: Lay flat on the floor with your arms at either side., With one leg, hook one foot under the joint of your other leg., Rotate your hips so that your knees are pointing sideways, keeping your hooked leg flat against the floor., Pause at the apex of the stretch and repeat with your other leg.

name: Lower back Stretch Variation One
description: Sit on the floor with the tops of your feet pointed and flat on the ground. Move your arms out in front of you in the diving position, placing your palms flat against the ground., With your arms fully extended, rest your buttocks on the heels of your feet, you can crawl your hands forward to extend the stretch if need be., Hold the extended position for a few seconds, and return to starting position.
steps: Sit on the floor with the tops of your feet pointed and flat on the ground. Move your arms out in front of you in the diving position, placing your palms flat against the ground., With your arms fully extended, rest your buttocks on the heels of your feet, you can crawl your hands forward to extend the stretch if need be., Hold the extended position for a few seconds, and return to starting position.

name: Supermans
description: Lie face down on the floor with your arms fully extended in front of you., Simultaneously raise your arms, legs and chest off of the floor and hold the position., Slowly lower your arms, legs and chest back to the starting position. Repeat.
steps: Lie face down on the floor with your arms fully extended in front of you., Simultaneously raise your arms, legs and chest off of the floor and hold the position., Slowly lower your arms, legs and chest back to the starting position. Repeat.

name: Plate Deadlift
description: Stand with feet hip-width apart, the plate in front of the feet, and the knees slightly bent., Bend the hips and knees to grip the plate with palms facing the body., Keeping the back straight, stand up while lifting the plate off the ground., Return the plate back to the starting position by bending the hips and knees, keeping control of the plate.
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart, the plate in front of the feet, and the knees slightly bent., Bend the hips and knees to grip the plate with palms facing the body., Keeping the back straight, stand up while lifting the plate off the ground., Return the plate back to the starting position by bending the hips and knees, keeping control of the plate.

name: Dumbbell Superman
description: Lay flat on the ground on your stomach with your arms extended overhead. Hold a dumbbell with a neutral grip., Lift your legs and chest off the ground simultaneously and hold for a 1 count at the top., Relax your lower back and lower your legs and chest back to the floor.
steps: Lay flat on the ground on your stomach with your arms extended overhead. Hold a dumbbell with a neutral grip., Lift your legs and chest off the ground simultaneously and hold for a 1 count at the top., Relax your lower back and lower your legs and chest back to the floor.

name: Happy Baby
description: Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor., Lift your feet off the floor and bring your knees towards your chest., Reach inside your knees and hold onto the outside edges of your feet., Gently pull your knees towards your armpits and rock side to side for a few breaths.
steps: Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor., Lift your feet off the floor and bring your knees towards your chest., Reach inside your knees and hold onto the outside edges of your feet., Gently pull your knees towards your armpits and rock side to side for a few breaths.

name: Sphinx Pose
description: Start by lying down on your stomach on a yoga mat or a comfortable surface., Place your elbows underneath your shoulders, keeping your forearms parallel to each other., Press your palms and forearms firmly into the ground to lift your chest up, while keeping your hips and legs relaxed., Make sure your shoulders are relaxed and away from your ears. Gently roll your shoulder blades down and back to open up your chest., Lengthen your spine by lifting the crown of your head towards the ceiling, while keeping your chin tucked in slightly.
steps: Start by lying down on your stomach on a yoga mat or a comfortable surface., Place your elbows underneath your shoulders, keeping your forearms parallel to each other., Press your palms and forearms firmly into the ground to lift your chest up, while keeping your hips and legs relaxed., Make sure your shoulders are relaxed and away from your ears. Gently roll your shoulder blades down and back to open up your chest., Lengthen your spine by lifting the crown of your head towards the ceiling, while keeping your chin tucked in slightly.

name: Traps mid back Stretch Variation Two
description: Sit on the ground and lay one leg flat and the other over the top., Hold your leg with the same side arm and slowly rotate your hips and back., Hold at the peak of the stretch, then slowly return to starting position., Switch sides and repeat.
steps: Sit on the ground and lay one leg flat and the other over the top., Hold your leg with the same side arm and slowly rotate your hips and back., Hold at the peak of the stretch, then slowly return to starting position., Switch sides and repeat.

name: Traps mid back Stretch Variation One
description: Repeat with your other arm., Stand up with your feet shoulder width apart. Place one arm across the front of your chest at shoulder height, press the forearm of your other arm above the elbow, hooking the stretching arm with your hand., Press the arm until it is straight and rotate your upper torso to engage the stretch even deeper.
steps: Repeat with your other arm., Stand up with your feet shoulder width apart. Place one arm across the front of your chest at shoulder height, press the forearm of your other arm above the elbow, hooking the stretching arm with your hand., Press the arm until it is straight and rotate your upper torso to engage the stretch even deeper.

name: Cat Pose
description: Begin on your hands and knees with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips., Inhale and arch your back, lifting your tailbone and head towards the ceiling, while lowering your belly towards the floor., Exhale and round your spine, tucking your chin towards your chest, and bringing your tailbone towards your knees., Repeat these movements, flowing smoothly between the two poses, for several breaths.
steps: Begin on your hands and knees with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips., Inhale and arch your back, lifting your tailbone and head towards the ceiling, while lowering your belly towards the floor., Exhale and round your spine, tucking your chin towards your chest, and bringing your tailbone towards your knees., Repeat these movements, flowing smoothly between the two poses, for several breaths.

name: Easy Seated Twist Pose
description: Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you., Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you., Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh., Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh., Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling., Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling., Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side., Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.
steps: Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you., Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you., Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh., Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh., Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling., Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling., Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side., Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.

name: Revolved Side Angle Pose With Prayer Hands
description: Begin in Warrior II pose, with your right foot forward and your left foot back., Bring your hands together in a prayer position at your heart., Exhale and twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee., Hold for several breaths and then repeat on the other side.
steps: Begin in Warrior II pose, with your right foot forward and your left foot back., Bring your hands together in a prayer position at your heart., Exhale and twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee., Hold for several breaths and then repeat on the other side.

name: Revolved Side Angle Pose With Prayer Hands Beginner
description: Begin in a low lunge position with your right foot forward and your left knee on the ground., Bring your hands together in a prayer position at your heart., Exhale and twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee., Hold for several breaths and then repeat on the other side.
steps: Begin in a low lunge position with your right foot forward and your left knee on the ground., Bring your hands together in a prayer position at your heart., Exhale and twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee., Hold for several breaths and then repeat on the other side.

name: Seated Twist
description: Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you., Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh., Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling., Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.
steps: Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you., Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh., Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling., Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.

name: Barbell Landmine Side Bend
description: SetupTo set up for a barbell landmine side bend exercise, you will need a barbell and a landmine attachment. If you do not have a landmine attachment, you can also use a sandbag, a heavy bag, or a bench.Foot PlacementStand with your feet shoulderwidth apart and your side to the barbell.How to do a Barbell Landmine Side BendGrasp the barbell with both hands, keeping your arms straight and your hands shoulderwidth apart. Lift the barbell off the ground and hold it in front of your hips, keeping your arms straight and your core engaged. Bend at the waist and reach the barbell towards the ground on the side of your body. Keep your arms straight and your core engaged as you bend. Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps. Make sure to keep your core engaged and your movements controlled throughout the exercise.
steps: Stand straight and hold the end of the Barbell, Keep your hips and shoulders facing forward, bend to one side slowly, Return to the upright position., Switch hands and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Wood Chopper
description: How To Perform The Dumbbell Wood ChopperSetupGrab a single dumbbell and hold it horizontally with the ends of the dumbbells in each hand. Use a wider than shoulder width stance. We have to hit both sides of the obliques with this exercise. So we will begin with going right to left. You can perform either side first.Start with the dumbbell on the outside of your right quadricep.Performing Think explosively when performing this movement. Rotate at the spine bringing the dumbbell from your right quadricep up to roughly eye level on your left side. Keep your elbows mostly extended. Do not rotate too far. The dumbbell should not go behind your body. Going behind the body will put too much stress on your lumbar spine. Also, as you are rotating at the spine, pivot your back foot. Your right foot in this example. Imagine you are performing a baseball bat or golf swing. Pivoting that back foot will keep your back knee from twisting too far.
steps: Stand with a shoulder width stance. Begin with the dumbbell near one of your quads., Rotate at your upper spine to engage the obliques., You can pivot your back foot to keep from generating too much torque at the knee.

name: Kettlebell Wood Chopper
description: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart and hold the kettle bell with both hands against your hip., Keeping your arms straight, swing the kettlebell upwards and across your body towards your shoulder, raising the kettlebell to head height rotating your hips as you do so., Return to the starting position and repeat.
steps: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart and hold the kettle bell with both hands against your hip., Keeping your arms straight, swing the kettlebell upwards and across your body towards your shoulder, raising the kettlebell to head height rotating your hips as you do so., Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Cable Wood Chopper
description: Set the cable at about nipple level. Use a handle attachment., Face sideways, then rotate your torso with your arms extended against the resistance., After completing your given number of reps, face the opposite direction and repeat.
steps: Set the cable at about nipple level. Use a handle attachment., Face sideways, then rotate your torso with your arms extended against the resistance., After completing your given number of reps, face the opposite direction and repeat.

name: Band Pallof Press
description: Place the band at an anchor point that is shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut., Start with your fingers interlocked around the band and your fists connected to your chest., Extend at the elbows pressing the band away from your body until your elbows are fully extended.
steps: Place the band at an anchor point that is shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut., Start with your fingers interlocked around the band and your fists connected to your chest., Extend at the elbows pressing the band away from your body until your elbows are fully extended.

name: Cable Pallof Press
description: How To Perform The Cable Pallof PressSetupYou want the cable at roughly nipple height. Use a d handle attachment or a nylon plastic handle. Either interlock your fingers or place one set of fingers over the other. Whichever is more comfortable.Take a couple of steps away from the cable stack and face sideways. The cable itself should be pulling you to the side. Use a slightly wider than shoulder width stance. Don't be hesitant to further widen your stance. The wider your stance, the bigger your base of support and the more weight you will likely be able to use.PerformingStart with your fists up against your chest. Press the cable away from you until your elbows are fully extended. In this extended position you should feel your obliques contract. The further away from your center of gravity the resistance goes, the harder it is on the obliques. This is why it is of the utmost importance that you fully extend your elbows on each rep. That extended position is the most important part of the movement so spend an extra second with your elbows extended. If you start fatiguing to a point you're unable to maintain your torso position, end the set.
steps: Use a handle attachment, set the cable at nipple level, walk a few steps away, and face sideways., Start with both hands on the handle and your fists against your chest., Press the handle forward until your elbows are fully extended, then pull the handle back to your chest.

name: Side Plank Up Down
description: Start with your elbow and hip on the ground. Either neutral fist or flat hand on the ground., Begin in a side plank position, and then drop your hips to the floor., Pull your hips back to the ceiling to finish the rep.
steps: Start with your elbow and hip on the ground. Either neutral fist or flat hand on the ground., Begin in a side plank position, and then drop your hips to the floor., Pull your hips back to the ceiling to finish the rep.

name: Side Plank Reach Through
description: Begin in an elbow side plank position., Reach for the ceiling with your off hand., Rotate at the mid and upper spine and reach through the open space between the floor and your torso., Reach backwards, and then rotate back into the starting position.
steps: Begin in an elbow side plank position., Reach for the ceiling with your off hand., Rotate at the mid and upper spine and reach through the open space between the floor and your torso., Reach backwards, and then rotate back into the starting position.

name: Elbow Side Plank
description: Press your elbow into the floor., Pick your hips up off the ground and maintain this position for the allotted amount of time., Make sure you dont let your chest fall forward or backward.
steps: Press your elbow into the floor., Pick your hips up off the ground and maintain this position for the allotted amount of time., Make sure you dont let your chest fall forward or backward.

name: Hand Side Plank
description: Press your hand into the ground and pick up your hip off the ground., Open your chest and maintain this position for the allotted amount of time.
steps: Press your hand into the ground and pick up your hip off the ground., Open your chest and maintain this position for the allotted amount of time.

name: Dumbbell Kneeling Wood Chopper
description: Start in a kneeling position with your shoulder blades pulled back., The dumbbell should begin by one of your hips., Rotate at the spine and bring the dumbbell from your hip, 180 degrees around your body. The dumbbell should land at eye level.
steps: Start in a kneeling position with your shoulder blades pulled back., The dumbbell should begin by one of your hips., Rotate at the spine and bring the dumbbell from your hip, 180 degrees around your body. The dumbbell should land at eye level.

name: Dumbbell Overhead Side Bend
description: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell overhead., From this starting position, bend to the side as far as you can while keeping your feet planted and your core engaged.
steps: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell overhead., From this starting position, bend to the side as far as you can while keeping your feet planted and your core engaged.

name: Dumbbell Side Plank Up Down
description: Start by lying on your side with your feet stacked on top of each other and a dumbbell on your hip., Place your bottom elbow on the ground beneath your shoulder and engage your core to raise your hips off the ground., Your hips will do all the moving. Think, hips up, hips down.
steps: Start by lying on your side with your feet stacked on top of each other and a dumbbell on your hip., Place your bottom elbow on the ground beneath your shoulder and engage your core to raise your hips off the ground., Your hips will do all the moving. Think, hips up, hips down.

name: Dumbbell Hand Side Plank
description: Start by lying on your side with your feet stacked on top of each other and a dumbbell on your hip., Place your bottom hand on the ground beneath your shoulder and engage your core to raise your hips off the ground., From this starting position, hold the side plank position for the desired amount of time, making sure to keep your body straight and your hips level.
steps: Start by lying on your side with your feet stacked on top of each other and a dumbbell on your hip., Place your bottom hand on the ground beneath your shoulder and engage your core to raise your hips off the ground., From this starting position, hold the side plank position for the desired amount of time, making sure to keep your body straight and your hips level.

name: Plate Standing Twist
description: Stand with a plate extended away from your body. Elbows mostly extended., Rotate at the upper spine while keeping your lumbar spine in a neutral position., Do not let the plate go behind your body.
steps: Stand with a plate extended away from your body. Elbows mostly extended., Rotate at the upper spine while keeping your lumbar spine in a neutral position., Do not let the plate go behind your body.

name: Plate Wood Chopper
description: Stand with a shoulder width stance. Begin with the plate near one of your quads., Rotate at your upper spine to engage the obliques., You can pivot your back foot to keep from generating too much torque at the knee.
steps: Stand with a shoulder width stance. Begin with the plate near one of your quads., Rotate at your upper spine to engage the obliques., You can pivot your back foot to keep from generating too much torque at the knee.

name: Dumbbell Long Lever Russian Twist
description: Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Hold a dumbbell in both hands with your arms extended straight in front of you., Twist your torso to the right, bringing the dumbbell towards the ground, then return to the center. Repeat on the left side, twisting to the left and bringing the dumbbell towards the ground., Continue this twisting motion, alternating sides, for the desired number of repetitions. Keep your core engaged and avoid swinging your arms to generate momentum.
steps: Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Hold a dumbbell in both hands with your arms extended straight in front of you., Twist your torso to the right, bringing the dumbbell towards the ground, then return to the center. Repeat on the left side, twisting to the left and bringing the dumbbell towards the ground., Continue this twisting motion, alternating sides, for the desired number of repetitions. Keep your core engaged and avoid swinging your arms to generate momentum.

name: Dumbbell Side Bend
description: Stand with feet hip-width apart and place your right hand on the right hip., Hold a dumbbell with the left hand. Bend at the hips to the side., Make sure you dont start to lean forward to try and force a longer range of motion.
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart and place your right hand on the right hip., Hold a dumbbell with the left hand. Bend at the hips to the side., Make sure you dont start to lean forward to try and force a longer range of motion.

name: TRX Forearm Side Plank
description: Lie on your side with your legs straight and your feet resting in the TRX foot cradles., Prop yourself up on your forearm and engage your core to maintain a straight line from your head to your feet.
steps: Lie on your side with your legs straight and your feet resting in the TRX foot cradles., Prop yourself up on your forearm and engage your core to maintain a straight line from your head to your feet.

name: TRX Oblique Crunch
description: Place your feet in the TRX stirrups and get in to a hand plank position., Pull both knees to your right elbow., Extend your legs back to the starting position, then pull both knees to the left elbow.
steps: Place your feet in the TRX stirrups and get in to a hand plank position., Pull both knees to your right elbow., Extend your legs back to the starting position, then pull both knees to the left elbow.

name: Gate Pose Variation Arm Extended on Side
description: Start on your knees and extend your right leg out to the side., Raise your right arm above your head and reach towards the left side of the room., Gently bend your body to the left side and rest your left hand on your left thigh., Look up towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.
steps: Start on your knees and extend your right leg out to the side., Raise your right arm above your head and reach towards the left side of the room., Gently bend your body to the left side and rest your left hand on your left thigh., Look up towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

name: Revolved Head To Knee
description: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you., Bend your right knee and bring your heel towards your perineum., Place your left hand on the outside of your right knee and twist your body to the right., Reach your right hand towards your left foot and look up towards the ceiling. Hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.
steps: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you., Bend your right knee and bring your heel towards your perineum., Place your left hand on the outside of your right knee and twist your body to the right., Reach your right hand towards your left foot and look up towards the ceiling. Hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

name: Seated Side Bend Pose
description: Sit comfortably on the floor with your legs crossed., Inhale and raise your right arm above your head., As you exhale, bend your body to the left side and rest your left hand on the ground., Look up towards the ceiling and hold the pose for a few breaths. Then switch sides and repeat the pose on the other side.
steps: Sit comfortably on the floor with your legs crossed., Inhale and raise your right arm above your head., As you exhale, bend your body to the left side and rest your left hand on the ground., Look up towards the ceiling and hold the pose for a few breaths. Then switch sides and repeat the pose on the other side.

name: Supine Twist Lying
description: Lie down on your back with your arms stretched out to your sides., Bend your right knee and bring it towards your chest., Slowly twist your body to the left side, bringing your right knee across your body towards the ground on the left side., Look towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.
steps: Lie down on your back with your arms stretched out to your sides., Bend your right knee and bring it towards your chest., Slowly twist your body to the left side, bringing your right knee across your body towards the ground on the left side., Look towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.

name: Wild Thing Pose
description: Start in a downward facing dog position., Shift your weight onto your left hand and foot, and lift your right leg towards the ceiling., Slowly bend your right knee and shift your weight onto your right hand as you open up your chest towards the ceiling., Look towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.
